text:
IE version 6 (haven't tested 7 yet) uploads jpegs with a mime type of pjpeg.
They then don't have any size information associated with them in our image
browser/insert tool. They then of course are inserted with a width and height of
0, which doesn't work so well. I don't see anything special about these images.
I downloaded one which a user uploaded and was identified as pjpeg. Uploaded
with FF 2.0 Windows and it went in as a jpeg no problem. Tried IE6 and it went
in as a pjpeg.
creator: rfrovarp@apache.org

text:
Further testing shows that IE 6 and 7 always claim the image is pjpeg. Opera and
Firefox always claim the image is jpeg. I've created a real pjpeg using GIMP and
everything works just fine in Lenya. The ImageIO library just doesn't think it
can handle that type. I'll look more into what can be done.
creator: rfrovarp@apache.org
rfrovarp@apache.org
text:
Fixed missing image size in r571280. This was the only problem caused by this IE
issue.
